alert.note: Alert for Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 5:44PM EDT until July 16 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR EASTERN SUFFOLK COUNTY... At 544 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain showers with embedded thunderstorms moving through the area. While the intensity of the rainfall has decreased, pockets of heavier rainfall of 0.5 to 1 inch an hour are still possible. This could aggravate areas where waters is slowly receding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fishers Island, Gardiners Island, Plum Island, East Hampton, Hither Hills State Park, Springs, Montauk and Orient. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
